head.title: Page P. Vincent Becomes a Bride

hedline.hl1: Page P. Vincent Becomes a Bride

block.p: LEAD: Page Pendleton Vincent, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Vincent Jr. of Bedford, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Thomas Duncanson Walker, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Walker of Barrington, R.I. The Rev. William Foley officiated at St. Matthew's Episcopal Church.

LEAD: Page Pendleton Vincent, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Vincent Jr. of Bedford, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Thomas Duncanson Walker, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Walker of Barrington, R.I. The Rev. William Foley officiated at St. Matthew's Episcopal Church.

Page Pendleton Vincent, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Vincent Jr. of Bedford, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Thomas Duncanson Walker, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Walker of Barrington, R.I. The Rev. William Foley officiated at St. Matthew's Episcopal Church.

The bride, 25 years old, is a graduate of Duke University. She is an account executive at North Castle Partners, an advertising agency in Stamford, Conn. Her father is a partner in the New York law firm of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom and the chairman of Barclay's Bank of New York. Her mother, Barbara M. Vincent, is a principal and a director of Educator's Ally, a faculty search and placement service in Bedford.

The bridegroom, 27, a graduate of Bates College, is an account executive in the New York office of the Western Publishing Company of Racine, Wis. His father is an executive vice president of the Bank of New England in Providence, R.I.
